name: CreateGroupTypeMetric
description:
Create a new metric for a specific group type.

This tool creates a new metric for a specified group type within a project. It should be called when you need to add a new performance or data metric to a group type for monitoring or analysis purposes.

parameters.name: group_type_index
parameters.description: An integer representing the index of the group type to which a new metric will be added.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Project ID for accessing the specific project. Make a call to /api/projects/ to retrieve available IDs.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

parameters.name: group_type_metric_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the metric you wish to create. It should be a string value.

parameters.name: metric_name
parameters.description: The name of the metric to be created for the group type. This should be a descriptive and unique identifier that helps distinguish this metric from others.

parameters.name: metric_filters
parameters.description: Optional filters to apply when creating the group type metric. It accepts a string of filter criteria to narrow down the data.

parameters.name: metric_format
parameters.description: Specify the format for the metric. Options are 'numeric' or 'currency'.

parameters.name: interval_in_days
parameters.description: Specify the interval in days for the metric data aggregation.

parameters.name: display_format
parameters.description: Specifies how the metric will be displayed: 'number' for a numeric display, or 'sparkline' for a graphical display.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the PostHog API.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.
